title: Too many ALU instructions compiling fragment shader
body:
### Info
The neovim cursor is barely visible because of it being completely black, as shown in the picture:
![Screenshot_20221018_102445](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93624576/196336966-9b4a8e24-75ae-4792-b8a2-ba5b89ef37c5.png)

I just want to change my cursor's color. It's fine in normal mode. Just the insert mode is bugging me.
### System
OS: Linux
Version: alacritty 0.11.0 (8dbaa0bb)
Linux/BSD: Xmonad WM, xfce4 desktop, picom compositor 
### Logs

Crashes: STDERR, STDOUT
```
Font/Terminal size: [0.000005518s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Welcome to Alacritty
[0.000228046s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Version 0.11.0 (8dbaa0bb)
[0.000276847s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Running on X11
[0.002294592s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Configuration files loaded from:
                                     "/home/neon/.config/alacritty/alacritty.yml"
[0.004452006s] [DEBUG] [alacritty] Loading "JetBrainsMono Nerd Font" font

../mesa-22.2.1/src/gallium/drivers/r300/compiler/r300_fragprog_emit.c::emit_alu(): Too many ALU instructions
Using a dummy shader instead.
[0.113617992s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Display scale factor: 1
[0.113653235s] [DEBUG] [alacritty] Filling glyph cache with common glyphs
[0.141414059s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Cell size: 10 x 24
```
